sensory_systems.name: Advanced Optical Metrology
sensory_systems.description: High-resolution optical systems for real-time monitoring of wafer surfaces and feature dimensions. Incorporates laser interferometry, digital holography, and structured light scanning.

specifications.resolution: Sub-nanometer (1-5 nm) for critical dimensions, 10-20 nm for general feature characterization.
specifications.accuracy: ±0.1-0.5% of measured dimension for critical features, ±1-3% for general features.
specifications.scanning_speed: Up to 1000 scans per second per sensor head.

sensory_systems.name: AI-Powered Defect Detection (Deep Learning)
sensory_systems.description: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) trained on massive datasets of wafer images to automatically identify defects such as voids, contamination, and etch damage. Includes anomaly detection.

specifications.accuracy: 95-98% defect detection accuracy (depending on training data and defect type).
specifications.processing_speed: Real-time defect detection on wafer scanning systems.
specifications.data_requirements: 100s of millions of images for training.

sensory_systems.name: Sub-wavelength Imaging Spectroscopy
sensory_systems.description: Utilizing hyperspectral imaging coupled with advanced spectral analysis to determine material composition and stress states at the nanoscale. Can identify subtle variations in dopant profiles and stress induced defects.

specifications.sensitivity: Detects changes in material composition at the ppm level.

sensory_systems.name: Acoustic Metrology
sensory_systems.description: Employing ultrasonic transducers for non-destructive evaluation of internal wafer defects and stress mapping.

control_systems.name: Model Predictive Control (MPC)
control_systems.description: Advanced control algorithms that predict future process behavior and optimize control actions to maintain process stability and minimize variations.

control_systems.name: Adaptive Control Systems
control_systems.description: Systems that automatically adjust control parameters based on real-time process feedback and learned models.

control_systems.name: Digital Twin Integration
control_systems.description: Real-time mirroring of the fab environment for simulation, optimization, and predictive maintenance.

specifications.model_fidelity: High-fidelity representation of fab equipment and processes.

mechanical_systems.name: High-Precision Robotic Manipulation
mechanical_systems.description: Advanced robotic arms with sub-micron positioning accuracy for wafer handling and equipment manipulation.

mechanical_systems.name: Dynamic Wafer Handling Systems
mechanical_systems.description: Wafer transport systems that maintain wafer flatness and orientation throughout the fab.  Utilizes active vibration damping.

mechanical_systems.name: Micro-Grippers
mechanical_systems.description: Specialized grippers with extremely high precision for handling wafers at nanoscale.

software_integration.name: Digital Fab OS
software_integration.description: Operating system specifically designed for semiconductor fabrication, integrating all fab systems.

specifications.interoperability: Standardized interfaces for communication between systems.

software_integration.name: Process Simulation & Optimization Software
software_integration.description: Advanced software for simulating wafer fabrication processes and identifying optimal parameter settings.

specifications.simulation_accuracy: High fidelity representation of fab processes.

software_integration.name: AI-Driven Recipe Management
software_integration.description: System that automatically generates and optimizes fabrication recipes based on sensor data and historical data.

future_technology.timeline_estimate: 5-15 years (Significant breakthroughs are needed in several areas to achieve full automation)
key_research_areas: Advanced Materials for Reduced Friction and Wear
Robust AI/ML for Process Understanding and Control
Quantum Sensing Technologies for Enhanced Detection
Digital Twin Validation and Calibration Techniques

input.system_message: You are an AI assistant specialized in forecasting future automation technologies. For the given topic, provide a comprehensive overview of technologies that would need to be created or refined to enable full automation in this field. Focus on realistic technological advancements that could be achieved in the next 5-15 years. For each technology, include specific technical specifications and accuracy metrics where appropriate.
input.user_message:
Create a detailed overview of future technologies needed for full automation of: Semiconductor Fabrication Automation

Format your response as a JSON object with these categories:
1. sensory_systems: Array of sensing technologies with descriptions and accuracy metrics
2. control_systems: Array of control mechanisms and their capabilities
3. mechanical_systems: Array of physical components and their specifications
4. software_integration: Array of software technologies needed to coordinate everything
5. timeline_estimate: Estimated years until these technologies could be realized
6. key_research_areas: Array of critical research domains that need breakthroughs

Please return ONLY valid JSON without any additional text, explanation, or code block formatting.
